question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: execute_liquidate()] [Return Value Manipulation] At line 238, function returns three u256 values. If any calculation overflows, can this return incorrect values to caller causing fund loss? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: execute_liquidate()] [Collateral List Inconsistency] If user has multiple collateral assets and one is fully liquidated, is the collateral list properly maintained or can it become corrupted? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state_of_all()] [Partial Update Exploit] At lines 246-250, if loop panics midway due to one reserve error, are previous updates rolled back or do they persist causing state inconsistency? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state_of_all()] [Gas Limit DoS] If reserves_count is very large, can this loop exceed gas limits causing all transactions that call it to fail? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state_of_all()] [Index Manipulation] If an attacker can add malicious reserves before this is called, can they cause the loop to update attacker-controlled indices? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state_of_all()] [Race Condition] If multiple transactions call update_state_of_all concurrently, can they interfere causing some reserves to be updated twice and others skipped? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state_of_all()] [Order Dependency] Does the order of reserve updates matter? Can an attacker benefit from knowing update order to time their operations? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Timestamp Manipulation] At line 262, timestamp_difference = (current_timestamp - last_update_timestamp) / 1000. If last_update_timestamp > current_timestamp due to clock manipulation, does this underflow? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Interest Calculation Overflow] At lines 271-272, if timestamp_difference is very large (e.g., years), can calculate_linear_interest overflow causing incorrect supply_index? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Compound Interest Overflow] At lines 275-276, calculate_compounded_interest could overflow if timestamp_difference and current_borrow_rate are both large. Does ray_mul handle this safely? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Treasury Calculation Error] At lines 279-283, treasury calculation involves multiple ray_mul operations. Can rounding errors accumulate to miscalculate treasury_amount? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Index Subtraction Underflow] At line 280, (new_borrow_index - current_borrow_index) assumes new >= current. If update_state is called with stale data, can this underflow? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Zero Total Borrow] At line 268, total_borrow is retrieved. If it's 0, does line 280 still calculate correctly or cause division issues later? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Reserve Factor Bounds] At line 267, reserve_factor is retrieved. If it's misconfigured to >100%, can treasury_amount exceed actual interest earned? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Scaled Treasury Underflow] At line 283, ray_div(treasury_amount, new_supply_index) requires new_supply_index > 0. Is this guaranteed or can supply_index become 0? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Double Supply Update] At lines 285-286, storage::update_state updates state and then increase_total_supply_balance increases supply. Can this cause double-counting of treasury? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_state()] [Precision Loss Accumulation] If update_state is called frequently with small timestamp_difference values, can precision loss in ray_mul accumulate significantly over time? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_interest_rate()] [Rate Calculation Error] At line 294, if calculate_borrow_rate returns incorrect value due to division by zero in utilization, does this propagate to supply_rate? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_interest_rate()] [Supply Rate Dependency] At line 295, supply_rate depends on borrow_rate. If borrow_rate is manipulated, can this cause supply_rate to be incorrect affecting all suppliers? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: update_interest_rate()] [Friend Visibility Abuse] Since this is friend-accessible, can other friend modules in the package call it at arbitrary times to manipulate rates? (Medium)
